title: Advanced Language Comprehension Course Based on Threshold Concepts: Prototype Analysis and Logico-Ontological Inquiry

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Understanding of Language Structure and Grammar
context.additional_context: Small-group collaborative learning environment utilizing digital devices, emphasizing prototype modeling activities for linguistic structure analysis

learning_goals: Learners can explain the five threshold concepts for understanding language phenomena (transformativity, irreversibility, integrativity, boundary, and counterintuitiveness) with 80% accuracy.
Learners can complete a project applying threshold concepts to real-world language examples using language pattern prototypes.
Learners are assessed on their ability to identify and explain "troublesome" aspects of language structures through ontological-logical analysis.
Learners submit an analysis of integrated applications of language threshold concepts with 70% or higher accuracy in the summative assessment.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
